description: This is ripe and fruity, a wine that is smooth while still structured. Firm tannins are filled out with juicy red berry fruits and freshened with acidity. It's  already drinkable, although it will certainly be better from 2016.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2011 Avidagos Red (Douro)

description: From an estate in the south of the Alentejo, this is a rich, hot-country wine. It is firm, densely structured and with solid, dark tannins. There is a juicy black fruit background to this dense wine that gives a lift. Still young, this dark and very concentrated wine will be better from 2018.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2013 Grande Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A year in wood and 30 months in bottle before release have allowed this attractive wine to fully develop its solid yet smooth texture. It has concentration, layers of bright black currant fruit and vibrant acidity. Ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2012 Montes Claros Garrafeira Red (Alentejo)

description: Wood aging gives this ripe blend of Baga and Touriga Nacional its richness and density. It's full of black fruit, toast and a touch of pepper. With ripe tannins and crisp acidity, it can easily age another year. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2013 Red (Beira Atlantico)

description: A powerful wine, richly structured and full of ripe fruits. It has a solid feel to it, firmly anchored to its dark tannins as well as lightened by the juicy berry flavors. A blend that includes Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, it needs serious aging, so don't drink before 2017.
title: Herdade Grande 2010 Gerações Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a new wine from the hands of master winemaker Luis Duarte. With its rich black fruits and dense tannins, it's also a wine that is firmly structured. Wood aging has added a layer of complexity and broadened out the fruits and dark tannins. Drink from 2017.
designation: Monte de Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada Tinto
title: Luis Duarte 2013 Monte de Carrapatelo Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: As its name suggests this is a selection of barrels of Syrah and Touriga Nacional. It is rich, smooth and full of ripe fruit. The dusty tannins are in suspension, backing up the black plum and blueberry fruit flavors. Along with the juicy acidity, this is a wine to age. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2013 Lagoalva Barrel Selection Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This is an impressive, powerful wine. It speaks of the hard landscape of the Douro Superior, with its structure and dark tannins. At the same time, ripe dark fruits push through the still-young tannins giving the potential for a rich, black fruit dominated wine. Predominantly Touriga Nacional (60 percent), this wine is a new venture created by João Nicolau d'Almeida (who has run Ramos-Pinto for many years) and his family. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Monte Xisto 2013 Red (Douro)

description: Powerful and concentrated, this is just at its peak. Ripe, rich fruit and tarry tannins give it freshness and a dry core. It's solid and serious, a dense wine that calls for equally rich food. Drink it now while it's at its prime.
title: Monte da Penha 2005 Grande Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This mature wine has a soft, smooth character and ripe fruit. With its red-berry flavors and gentle tannins, it's very ready to drink. The blend is dominated by Touriga Nacional from an estate at the heart of the Douro vineyards in Pinhão.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 VT '08 Red (Douro)

description: A ripe and structured wine, this has bold black fruits and balanced tannins that still need to soften. It has good potential with rich fruits and a tight mineral texture. Drink from 2018.
title: Sobredos 2012 Aneto Tinto Red (Douro)

description: The latest release from the partnership between the Roquette family of Quinta do Crasto in the Douro and the Cazes family of Château Lynch-Bages in Bordeaux. The wine brings out considerable minerality, a herbal edge along with forward black currant fruit. It is austerely structured at this stage and needs aging for several years.
title: Roquette e Cazes 2007 Red (Douro)

description: Just lightly touched by wood this is a bright and fruity wine that is ready to drink. Spice and red-berry fruits dominate, lifted by balanced tannins. Drink now.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2014 Evel Tinto Red (Douro)

description: It is the 30% Alicante Bouschet in the blend that gives the dense color to this ripe wine. Concentrate and rich, the generous berry flavors are balanced by a more restrained acidity and smoky flavors. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Santos & Seixo 2014 Santos da Casa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a major Douro wine from the Poças family-owned Port and wine producer. Dusty tannins already give it class as well as richness. Packed with black-plum fruits and with good concentration, the wine is still maturing. It needs to age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Poças 2014 Símbolo Red (Douro)

description: A rich full wine that has swathes of black fruits. It has a dry core around which there are generous fruits and the right amount of acidity. Perfumed, ripe and concentrated, this is ready to drink now.
title: Casa Agricola Santos Jorge 2012 Herdade dos Machados Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Syrah, Castelão and Aragonez go into the blend of this rich juicy wine. It is so soft and ripe, just hinting at tannins and with red-berry fruit. The wine is round and smooth, ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Lisboa)

description: Old vines, many up to 80-years-old, supply the grapes that were fermented in traditional granite lagars for a ripe jammy character in this powerful wine. It has solid tannins and great acidity, both of which will allow the wine to age. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.
title: Quinta da Foz 2016 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This estate whose name means four winds is in the Douro Superior, the easternmost part of the Douro region. It is intensely rich and solid—a classic blend for the region with a dominance of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca, aged in wood and with plenty more aging ability. This black-fruit-flavored wine will be best from 2020.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2014 Quinta dos Quatros Ventos Red (Douro)

description: The Reserva version of the popular Borba brand in Portugal is a dense, powerfully tannic wine. Its juicy black currant and blackberry fruits are suffused with tannins—its dry core surrounded by richness. Hints of dark chocolate and pepper come from the alcohol but certainly don't take away from the great fruitiness of the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Marquês de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: This producer specializes in seeking out parcels of old vines. In this case, the vines, planted at high density, have unusually crooked trunks. The wine itself, richly tannic and dense, has new wood flavors, ripe black-plum fruits and a dark firm character. It is still young and will develop into an impressively rich wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Crooked Vines Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine that has a dry tanninc core. That gives a mineral texture to the otherwise ripe and fruity wine. Full of black currant fruit flavors, shot through with acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Red (Dão)

description: This deeply impressive blend of 20 different varieties comes from a vineyard at the top of the Gaivosa estate that was oddly ignored for many years. With black plum fruit, dense tannins and intense acidity, it's built for longterm aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Alves de Sousa 2013 Abandonado Red (Douro)

description: From the historic Herdade do Mouchão in northern Alentejo, this is a powerful wine, full of dense tannins and impressively ripe, juicy black fruits. Syrah and Alicante Bouschet bring southern richness to Touriga Franca and Touriga Nacional. Drink this wine now.
title: Mouchão 2012 Ponte das Canas Red (Alentejo)

description: This simple and fruity wine is made to be drunk young. And with its red fruits, light acidity and crisp texture, it succeeds. Drink the wine with summer barbecues.
title: Sanguinhal 2016 Cerejeiras Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an open and ready-to-drink wine that has soft tannins and juicy blackberry fruit. With 50% Aragonez in the blend, it is has a smooth character that brings out plenty fruit and not too much structure. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Red (Alentejo)

description: Named after the poppy that blooms in May in the Alentejo, this wine is juicy and fruity, with a light touch of tannins. It is all red berries, with an easygoing juicy character, Drink now.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Flor de Maio Mayflower Red (Alentejano)

description: Young and fruity, this is a bright and wine for immediate drinking. It has hints of tannins, plenty of red fruits and no wood.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Brado Red (Alentejano)

description: Structured and with solid tannins, this is a wood- and spice-laden wine. Its fruit lies somewhere behind all this structure and is likely to remain there.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Dona Helena Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: There are firm and dusty tannins in this spicy wine. It has firm fruit, a solid texture and a juicy, nutmeg-flavored aftertaste. Drink from 2018 when some of the tannins have softened.
title: Enoport 2014 Topázio Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Tinta Miúda, known as the rare Graciano grape in Spain, is not often found in Portugal. Here it makes a ripe, juicy and jammy wine that's soft, with only a minimum of tannins to keep it together. It has a typically warm character and is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Tinta Miúda Red (Tejo)

description: Mula Velha, “the old donkey,” is a younger wine than its name suggests. Brisk and fruity, it offers firm tannins and layers of blackberry fruit. With a touch of oak aging, the wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Mula Velha Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This wine is ripe, full of black fruits and soft tannins. With plenty of acidity to keep it crisp, the wine has a cool, flavorful character topped off by berry fruits. It's ready to drink.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Terra Grande Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is light in tannins and ripe in fruit, with a delicious red-berry character. Drink this attractive wine from 2019.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2015 Lote 138 Red (Douro)

description: A firm wine, with dark chocolate and coffee flavors. The fruit flavors are  dark fig and stewed plums; there is a bitter edge to the tannins.
title: Quinta do Grifo 2004 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The local grape Castelão is blended with Cabernet Sauvignon in this soft, spicy and fruity wine. Red fruits and balanced acidity are given a shove by a lightly tannic structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2014 Terra de Lobos Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Pitch-black wine, very dense. It is spicy with concentrated black fruits, layered with equally intense acidity. Wood, fruit and sweet berries are all there. Tannins surround this firm wine, promising aging over 5–6 years.
title: Castro Pena Alba 2007 Picos de Couto Grande Escolha Red (Dão)

description: Very Douro in its mineral texture and dry core, it also has a surround of ripe black fruits. It's concentrated and has some aging potential, although it can be drunk now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2010 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: Still young, it is full of spice from wood aging along with juicy black fruits. It is soft, dominated by black currant and acidity. Not for aging, it will be ready by the end of 2014.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2012 Red (Tejo)

description: The tannins are firm, still controlling the black fruits in this wine. It is concentrated, with considerable extraction giving a dry wine with a hard edge. The red-berry flavors are lost.
title: Quinta da Padrela 2013 Premium Red (Douro)

description: This wine is ripe with red fruits and soft tannins. It is smooth, packed with red-berry flavors lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, it is ready now.
title: Adega Mãe 2015 Pinta Negra Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Smooth red-berry fruits give this wine a glow of ripeness. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet is dense and full of dark berries, with a touch of wood aging to smooth everything out. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Fortissimo Red (Alentejano)

description: This densely tannic wine is bold and linear, with concentrated chocolate and spice flavors. Rich black fruits are layered with acidity and a tight, mineral texture. Still firm, the wine is not likely to soften more, so drink now.
title: Caves Transmontanas 2013 Vertice Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine comes from vineyards outside the boundaries of the Dão region but has the same typical blend. It shows minerality as well as rich fruit and soft tannins. The wine is balanced, stylish and deliciously ready to drink.
title: Caves Velhas 2014 D. Fuas Reserva Red (Terras do Dão)

description: Made to drink young, this fruity, softly structured wine is ripe with blackberry fruits. There is a touch of spice from the wood aging and a lining of attractive acidity. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2015 Ardósia Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: The quinta for this wine is on the plateau north of the Douro river. It has produced a red-fruit wine, rich with soft tannins and juicy fruitiness. The wood aging is already well integrated into this bold, ripe wine. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: This simple, open and fruity wine has gentle tannins. It is all about ripe berries and acidity. Made to be drunk young for its fruitiness, it is ready now.
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Colheita Red (Beira Interior)

description: A wine that starts out all tannins. The fruit takes a while to show through and then produces juicy red cherry flavors and considerable acidity, the wood aging rounding the corners. This is for medium-term aging.
title: Rozes 2008 Quinta do Grifo Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This feels very ripe, perhaps overripe, with its seemingly sweet flavor of black fruit juice and its soft structure. It's appealing and does have some tannins, but it is not for aging.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2009 Morgado da Canita Red (Alentejano)

description: Light and stalky, this has black currant fruit and considerable acidity. With its soft tannins and fruity character, it is ready to drink now.
title: Aveleda 2011 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: This is a fruity, juicy wine with wood and bright red fruits in equal balance. The entry-level wine made by a grouping of 19 growers, it has concentration along with minerality and acidity. It needs to age further, so drink from 2018.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2014 Très Bagos Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Named after a local volcanic rock formation, this wine is a delicious blend of Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) and Touriga Nacional. It is rich and smooth with black fruits, soft tannins and an aftertaste that is lively with acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Manzwine 2014 Penedo do Lexim Red (Lisboa)

description: Portugal's popular brand is a lively, fresh, spice- and dried fruit-flavored wine. There are flavors of pound cake and nutmeg surrounding a core of solid, firm tannins. Great with food, this is not for aging.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2007 Marquês de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: The second wine from Malhadinha Nova is lively and fruity, packed with red fruits, sweet strawberry flavors and easy, ripe texture. Drink now.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2006 Monte da Peceguina Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine has fine tannins, ripe berry fruits and well-integrated acidity. Rich and juicy, it offers blackberry flavors and a crisp aftertaste. Drink this wine, part of a range of wines from across Portugal, from 2018.
title: Santos & Seixo 2013 Santos da Casa Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A blend from two vineyards, this wine is rich and full bodied, with fine tannins and a dark concentration. With its perfumed character and tight structure, it is impressive, full of black fruits with a strong mineral streak. Drink this still-young wine from 2019.
title: Bulas 2010 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Produced in the Douro Superior region in the far east of the Douro Valley, this wine is dense with tarry tannins and black fruits. Wood aging and the concentration of old vines make it impressive. Drink now until 2022.
title: Quinta da Zaralhôa 2008 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The Reserve version of this brand, this young wine is ripe and firm, with great potential. The Duas Quintas (two estates) are Ervamoira and Bons Ares, both in the Douro Superior. With attractive smoky flavors and ripe red-berry fruits it will become a rich wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2014 Duas Quintas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich, full wine that has red fruits and soft tannins. With balanced acidity, only a hint of tannins, it is ready to drink.
title: Parras Vinhos 2014 Montaria Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is fresh with red berry flavors and a stalky tannic core. It's lightly perfumed, light in texture and ready to drink.
title: Wine with Spirit 2013 Bastardo! Black Edition Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: Rustic aromas are followed by rough-edged fruitiness in this young wine. It has ripe berry fruits as well as some firm tannins in the background. It is not yet integrated and needs to develop much more. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Porrais Red (Douro)

description: In this blend of Shiraz and Trincadeira, both grapes contribute red fruits, soft tannins and fresh-faced acidity. With no complications—just bright, juicy fruit—the wine is ready to drink.
title: Falua 2013 Tagus Creek Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This structured wine has a strong mineral element. With black-currant and berry flavors, it is firm and still young. Swathes of rich fruit are sustained by solid tannins. Drink from late 2017.
title: Parras Wines 2015 Evidência Red (Dão)

description: The second wine of Vale Meão, this is rich and fruity. It has enough structure to allow it to develop while also having plenty of red-berry fruits and soft tannins. Give this wine until 2019.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2014 Meandro do Vale Meão Red (Douro)

description: Red-berry fruits and soft tannins give a wine with some juicy acidity and spice. The firm aftertaste shows that it is still needs time. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2013 Dona Matilde Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Spice from wood aging is the initial character of this wine. Then the fruit comes through more strongly to give the wine richness and structure. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta dos Poços 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A broad, welcoming wine, the second label from Malhadinha Nova. It has spiced acidity, flavors of plums, licorice, with cranberry juice tannins. The flavors are big and bold, nothing held back.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2008 Monte da Peceguina Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: A fresh, juicy wine with berry fruits, ripe but intense tannins and a black cherry flavor. There is a delicious, final burst of acidity.
title: Real Companhia Velha 2007 Porca de Murça Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Bold and fruity, this wine shows the richness of the black fruits. It has fruit tannins, a lush texture and a dry core. With its density and its ripe fruit, it could age further. Drink from 2018.
designation: Santos da Casa Reserva Sem Barrica Unoaked
title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Santos da Casa Reserva Sem Barrica Unoaked Red (Alentejano)

description: The perfumes of Touriga Nacional dominate this soft, smooth wine. A layer of tannins gives structure, and the ripeness of the fruit creates a delicious, full-bodied wine.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2015 Ribeiro Santo Red (Dão)

description: A ripe and juicy wine, the wood flavors giving considerable spice character. Acidity and blackberry fruits work into a wine that has an attractive, if rough-at-the-edges, character.
title: Terra d'Alter 2009 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This blend of this wine is popular in Alentejo with Syrah now part of the repertoire. The wine is warm, with a ripe character and a sunny feel. Its structure and acidity keep the wine balanced. Drink now.
title: Falua 2014 Tagus Creek Shiraz-Trincadeira Red (Alentejano)

description: Made by the winemaking team of Quinta de la Rosa, this powerful and bold wine comes from vineyards up river in Douro Superior. It is full of dark, dense black fruits and concentrated tannins with brisk acidity on the finish. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2010 Passagem Reserva Red (Douro)

description: VV refers to the old vines that are at the heart of this impressive wine. It has great concentration both from the richly structured fruit and tannins. New wood comes through richly on this powerhouse of texture and density. Give the wine at least six years to mature.
title: Wine & Soul 2010 Quinta da Manoella VV Red (Douro)

description: This is a smooth, impressively rich wine powered by silky tannins and ripe black fruits. The palate is intensely concentrated with a big, bold structure and a solid feel. It does need some aging, so drink from 2016.
designation: Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2009 Aguia Moura em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A fresh-faced wine, bright with berry fruits, a light layer of tannins and a soft, easy texture. There is some stalkiness but this is great as a delicious, easy wine.
title: Cortes de Cima 2009 Chaminé Red (Alentejano)

description: A juicy, fruity wine that is named after the Knights Templar who built a magnificent castle and convent in the local city of Tomar. It is fresh with red berry acidity and some perfumed tannins. It should be ready to drink soon, but wait until the end of 2016 for the best results.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2013 Templários Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Light red wine, with a stalky black currant character. It is very fruity, showing herbs and soft tannins. Almost an apéritif red, certainly one for lightly flavored dishes.
title: Aveleda 2010 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Portuguese Table Wine)

description: Blackberry jam aromas lead to a fruity wine, soft and juicy. Fresh and rounded, it has balanced acidity and an open, generous character. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2013 Santos da Casa Red (Alentejano)

description: This huge, fruity wine is packed with tannins and superripe fruits. It's a big wine in all senses, from its massive structure to its bold red berry flavors. There's a ripe, juicy end to this powerful wine.
title: Campolargo 2011 Valdazar Red (Bairrada)

description: One of the top wines from this producer, this blend of at least 10 grape varieties comes from its estate. The wood aging has added sophistication to this already concentrated wine. With black fruits to the fore and firm tannins, it will age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Confidencial Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: Now deliciously mature, this rich wine is smooth and dense. Produced by the Cálem family, one of the great names of the Douro, the wine is laden with big black fruits and tarry tannins. The wine is very ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 Sagrado Reserva Red (Douro)

description: From 24 different varieties of old vines, this wine is rich, bold and ripe. Without any wood aging, it is solid with tannins and dense structure. There is a juicy background coming from the blackberry and damson fruits. Drink this serious, ageworthy wine from 2019.
title: Casa da Passarella 2013 O Oenólogo Vinhas Velhas Red (Dão)

description: A soft and ripe wine with gentle tannins and spicy black currant fruit, this tastes dry and has fine acidity and a juicy aftertaste. The name is a reminder that the vineyards are close to the Atlantic Ocean.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2014 Mar de Lisboa Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a dark- colored, smoothly ripe wine. With wood spice and with plenty of blackberry fruitiness, it's both structured and generous. The acidity it gets from the Touriga Nacional in the blend gives it a crisp aftertaste and the possibility of further aging. Drink now or from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2015 Touriga Nacional-Merlot-Syrah Red (Tejo)

description: This blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is surprisingly soft and ripe, considering the tannic nature of the grapes. Instead it has fruity black currant flavors and plenty of forward acidity. Ready to drink now, its tannins just form the background.
title: Fiuza 2015 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: Inspired by the two halves of the Douro (the other being Ribera del Duero in Spain), this Portuguese wine has minty, ripe, velvet textures, smooth and full-bodied. Very polished and classy, with soft acidity, tarry tannins, new wood and plum juice flavors.
title: Sogevinus 2006 D + D Red (Douro)

description: This wine offers very ripe fruit that gives an almost-sweet character to what should be a dry wine. There is acidity that helps. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Castelinho 2013 Quinta Dona Mafalda Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This is an easy, fruity wine. Soft and light in character, it has attractive red fruits and acidity. Drink this wine now.
title: Jose Maria Vieira 2014 Borges Quinta da Soalheira Red (Douro)

description: This soft wine has muted red fruits and light acidity. Drink now.
title: Kopke 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is ripe, fruity and balanced. It has red-berry flavors along with acidity and a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2015 Esteva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is soft, with gentle tannins and red-berry fruits. It will develop quickly, so drink from 2019.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2015 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: Strong tannins dominate this wine. It comes from a good vintage, but it is quite extracted. It could soften, although it may remain a tough wine.
title: Quinta do Filoco 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The tannins dominate this wine, giving a hard-edged character. It is firm but without the fruit weight to support it.
title: Quinta dos Poços 2014 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This soft, wine is full of ripe black-currant flavors. It is smooth and rounded, with a touch of wood and plenty of acidity. Drink now.
title: Sanguinhal 2013 Casabel Red (Lisboa)

description: This ripe blend holds 80% Baga, with the rest Merlot. The Merlot softens the firmer tannins of the Baga, giving the wine its red-fruit character with a juicy aftertaste. Drink the wine now.
title: Messias 2014 Selection Red (Bairrada)

description: This is a mature, single-vineyard wine. Beautifully perfumed, it includes, unusually, a small percentage of white grapes (historically a field blend) that soften the tannins of the 90% Baga. The wine is spicy, concentrated, dense with black fruits and tannins. It is ready to drink.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Monte Cascas Vinha das Cardosas Red (Bairrada)

description: This is a solid mineral and tannin dominated wine. It has black currant fruits which are still buried by the tense tannins and stalky texture. It therefore needs some time to develop and broaden out. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2011 Pomares Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: The wine is young, still more structure than fruit. It has firm tannins as well as juicy blackberry fruits. A blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional, it is likely to age for a few months, so drink from the end of 2016.
title: Fiuza 2014 3 Castas Red (Tejo)

description: Towards the western end of the Douro vineyards, Avidagos is a fine place for table wines. This young, ripe and rounded wine is made to be drunk young. It has great black fruits and acidity that are linked by the firm tannin background. The wine will be ready from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta dos Avidagos 2014 Avidagos Red (Douro)

description: A mixed bag of varieties went into this soft and fruity wine. It has gentle tannins that are lifted by acidity and black currant fruitiness. With its lifestyle label (a small Vespa motor scooter), it is obviously meant to be an easy-going ready-to-drink wine. And it succeeds.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Bonavita Red (Lisboa)

description: The style of this wine is fruity with blackberry flavors giving a bright and lively character. Black currant acidity joins in the fruitiness while allowing room for some structured tannins. The wine will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Terras de Alter 2015 Terra d'Alter Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich, ripe and full-bodied blend that includes Alicante Bouschet to give the dark color. It has structure and juicy blackberry fruits. The tannins, integrated with the fruitiness, are supple and generous. This is a wine to drink soon, from late 2016.
title: Herdade Grande 2013 Audaz Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Made to be consumed young, this is fresh and fruity. It has a layer of tannins that support the red berry and plum fruit tones. The aftertaste is fresh and fruity. Drink now.
title: Evel 2012 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a hard, edgy and tannic wine that has a bitter edge overlaying the fruit. It seems tough, although there are hints of ripe berry fruits that are hiding away. Some softening over the next year will offer integration. Drink from 2016.
title: Quinta dos Aciprestes 2011 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Still firm in tannins, this has developed into an austere and dark wine. It is serious and solid, with a firm, brooding character and layers of acidity as well as black currant fruits. It is probably ready to drink now.
title: Azamor 2010 Red (Alentejano)

description: Rich and ripe, with soft tannins and black plum flavors. It is round, while still having a core of attractive tannins. The fruit dominates, giving a friendly, accessible wine.
title: Alente 2007 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: Fresh, juicy wine, with soft tannins and taut red cherry fruit. The tannins provide a discreet backbone. Age for 2–3 years.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2010 JP Azeitão Tinto Red (Setubal)

description: The Reserva version of Mural makes a powerful statement. Dark in color and packed with concentrated fruit, it is full of tannins as well as brooding black-plum flavors. Spice and juicy acidity complete the ensemble. It's a solid wine that needs to age to soften the tannic structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Portal 2011 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is a fine exposition of the structure and density of a serious Douro wine. A field blend, it is packed with dark berry fruits and sweet tannins, with a strong mineral element that reflects the tough schist of the vineyards. It's drinkable now, but the wine will be better in 2016.
title: Quinta do Sagrado 2008 VT '08 Red (Douro)

description: There is a strong barnyard aroma here, although the palate is cleaner and more modern. With rich tannins and a dark plum character, it's ripe and structured. There is a strong mineral element, giving the wine power and density. Drink from 2016.
title: Borges 2011 Lello Red (Douro)

description: The second vintage of this wine comes from a great Douro year. It gives structure, dark fruits and a serious tannic structure that has been rounded by wood aging. Spice, berries and mint flavors all contribute to this powerful, ageworthy wine. Drink from 2017.
title: Muxagat 2011 Cisne Red (Douro)

description: A powerful and concentrated blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez. Solid blackberry flavors give the wine strength, while tannins and hot pepper bring out bitterness and spice. It's not a wine for the faint-hearted.
title: Herdade da Gâmbia 2011 Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is an attractive wine, dominated by the typical Baga grape from Bairrada. Its tannins are tamed and rounded out producing rich black fruits and fine balanced acidity. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be even better from 2017.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Red (Bairrada)

description: The wine is juicy and rich. Its soft texture comes from fermentation in tanks that recycle CO2 to give a gentle extraction. The result is rounded, smooth, full of black fruits and with plenty of crisp acidity to finish.
title: Quinta do Pôpa 2015 Contos da Terra Red (Douro)

description: Aged for two years in wood, this ripe wine is rich and structured. It has the firm tannins and minerality typical of the Dão while also having balanced fruit and acidity. It is firm, although ripe, and ready to drink.
title: Borges 2013 Reserva Tinto Red (Dão)

description: Light wood aging over six months has given this wine a polished character. Along with the rich black-plum fruits and acidity, it is a full-bodied wine—a very Portuguese blend of five varieties. The tannins keep the wine in shape and add to its ripe structure. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Palha Canas Red (Lisboa)

description: Vegetal, green flavors appear on a wine that doesn't balance the fruit and structure. Considering its age, it needs to be drunk now.
title: Além 2006 Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is soft, fruity, rounded and red fruit flavored. Soft tannins and black plum skins give the wine a light structure. The wine is developing well and will be ready to drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2014 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Douro)

description: This is a soft and fruity wine that is full of red berries and balanced acidity. It has some tannins, while wood aging has given extra richness. The finish is fresh, bright and juicy. Drink from 2016.
title: Falua 2013 Conde de Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Named after the city of Evora, capital of Alentejo and close to the winery, this is a finely made impressive wine. While it is rich, it's ripe, smooth and packed with berry fruits as well as balanced tannins. It is still developing and although it can be drunk soon, it will be better aged for several more years. Ideally, wait until 2018.
title: Cartuxa 2011 Foral de Evora Tinto Colheita Red (Alentejo)

description: Expanding the Casal Garcia range into the Douro, this light and fruity wine is an easy drink. It has some toast to balance the soft tannins and black currant fruits.
title: Aveleda 2014 Casal Garcia Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This wine is definitely woody, with tough toast over the fruit flavors and mineral texture, yielding a bitter, extracted character that will always feel dry. However, give it until 2016 and the fruit may get a chance to shine.
title: Dão Sul 2013 Cabriz Colheita Seleccionada Red (Dão)

description: Adding Syrah (Shiraz as the producer calls it) to the blend with Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional gives a strongly perfumed character to this firm, still structured wine. It also has a fresh element from the black currant acidity that cuts through the wine. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a bold and ripely fruity wine. Fine tannins and blackberry fruits are already well combined in a big and juicy whole. The wine does have a structure and layers of wood aging that suggest it will age. Drink from 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Abreu Callado Reserva  Red (Alentejano)

description: This mature wine is beginning to dry out with its dark tannins and leather texture. A complex wine, it's on the point of losing its fruitiness, giving a firm structure along with juicy acidity at the end. Drink now.
title: Perescuma 2007 Orquestra Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A smoky wine with black currant flavors that bring together spice and fruitiness. The wine has a light touch, licorice and stalky tannins ending with attractive juiciness. It is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Bigode Red (Lisboa)

description: An earthy wine that has red berry fruits and acidity alongside a rustic barnyard character. There is a mineral edge to the wine as well, so maybe giving it a year will help.
title: Tiago Teles 2012 Gilda Red (Bairrada)

description: The second wine from Duorum, the brand created by João Portugal Ramos and José Soares Franco in 2007, this is ripe with tannin, black fruit and juicy acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Duorum 2015 Tons de Duorum Red (Douro)

description: This wine from the mountain vineyards of eastern Portugal is rich, fruity and made to be drunk young. With soft tannins and juicy red berry fruit, it's open and ripe. Drink now.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2014 Barão de Figueira Red (Beira Interior)

description: This wine is full of red berry flavor and soft tannins. With its forward fruit and smooth texture, it's made to be drunk young, so drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This broad, fruity wine brings out ripe berry flavors in spades. It has generous fruit, soft tannins and a smooth, open texture. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Convento da Vila Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine has too much wood, with high toast and spice. The fruit is dominated by this wood that is not likely to soften.
title: Lavradores de Feitoria 2014 Meruge Red (Douro)

description: This wine has a geranium aroma and a strangely perfumed character. It is light and fruity although not likely to develop much.
title: Quinta do Romeu 2011 Red (Douro)

description: This wine is woody, showing concentrated toast and vanilla flavors. It seems to be missing its fruit.
title: Roncão 2012 Quinta da Levandeira Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is perfumed with geranium aromas and rhubarb flavors. It is strange and not likely to improve.
title: Quinta do Romeu 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A big, ripe and spicy wine, this is packed with woody notes as well as powerful fruit. It has solid tannins and dark flavors of bitter chocolate and black cherries. It's rich and concentrated, with good aging potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Poças 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: From the coastal plain of the Beiras, this cool and structured blend of Baga and Touriga Nacional has a fine poise between acidity and sweet berry fruits. It's a complex, textured wine. Fresh and fruity on the one hand and dark and brooding on the other, it needs time, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta de Foz de Arouce 2011 Red (Beira Atlantico)

description: With 12 months wood aging, this powerful wine has managed to keep a great sense of balance. Solid tannins are tempered by a more dusty texture, smooth black plum fruits, rich, concentrated acidity and juicy final fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2011 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: French oak aging has given this still-young wine a firmly structured character, with dark tannins and a firm texture. It's still very dry, structured and dark and needs a good few years to age and round out. For now, the ripe fruit and acidity are both showing great promise. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Rede 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Quinta Nova has produced two Grand Reservas in 2012. This is leaner than the other, a more structured wine with dry tannins and great concentration. It will need several years to soften and bring out its natural mineral richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2012 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This is the second wine from the Pintas vineyard in the heart of the Pinhão valley. It's powered by mint, dark plums and new wood flavors to give a richly concentrated, juicy wine. It's still young, showing all its initial fruitiness, and those tannins and acidity will need several years. Drink from 2017.
title: Wine & Soul 2012 Pintas Character Red (Douro)

description: While the familiar white version of this wine is from Vinho Verde, the producers have gone a little further south to the Douro for the red. That gives a soft wine but with weight and attractive layers of red-berry fruits and a touch of warmth. Drink now.
title: Aveleda 2015 Casal Garcia Red (Douro)

description: This wine is packed with flavor from the ripe blend of Shiraz, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional. Its berry fruits and balanced acidity give the wine an easy, juicy character. The gentle tannins are easily integrated with the fruit. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Red (Lisboa)

description: A dark and richly dense wine, this is packed with black fruit notes and concentrated tannins. Aged in French and American oak, it has a strongly spicy character, with bright acid and a solid tannic structure. Drink after 2015.
title: Caves Aliança 2011 Alabastro Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Made to be drunk young, this is a fruity red berry flavored wine. It has a bright crisp edge to its fruit as well as light tannins and acidity. It is quite ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2014 Vinea Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: With some earthy, rustic flavors the wine seems to have missed out on some of its fruit. It is more about structure and firm tannins with only hints of juicy fruit behind.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Monta da Baía Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of typical Alentejo grapes, this is a firm effort, with the fruit laced inbetween the complex tannic structure. The acidity gives the wine a final lift.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 4 Quatro Castas Red (Alentejano)

description: This firm and generous blend of Touriga Nacional and Alicante Bouschet is powerful, with great black fruits and layers of firm tannins. Its structure and concentration are made for aging. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Fiuza 2016 Babu Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: The familiar rosé Lancers is all about crushed strawberries with a touch of sugar. There is a light structure, but the attractive light pink color and the fresh fruit all work together. Screwcap.
title: José Maria da Fonseca NV Lancers Rosé Red (Table wine)

description: Rich, soft and spicy, this is a warm, ripe wine. With its flavors of figs, black plums and herbs, it certainly sums up the heat of the Douro, leaving some good fresh acidity to finish.
title: Sogevinus 2006 Curva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is an initially smooth wood-aged wine that is intense, concentrated and packed with power and tannins. It is rich and full of brooding dark plum and dense with structure. Dominated by Touriga Nacional, it has that variety's perfumed character which is balanced by the smoother Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz. It is obviously a wine to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This wine is ripe with acidity and red-berry fruits, with firm tannins that will soften. Drink this attractive, fruity wine from 2019.
title: Quevedo 2014 Claudia's Red (Douro)

description: While this wine is dry, it offers good fruit weight that will fill out as it matures. It has a smoky character with juicy red-berry fruits in the background. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo 2014 Reserva Unoaked Red (Douro)
winery: Quinta Nova de Nossa Senhora do Carmo

description: This is a solidly tannic wine. A dry edge comes from the Baga grape in the blend. At the same time, the wine has plenty of ripe black fruits that give a rounder character. The wine is ready to drink, although it will be better from late 2017.
title: Messias 2012 Quinta do Valdoeiro Colheita Red (Bairrada)

description: Made from a selection of premium parcels, this wood-aged wine still shows evidence of its toast and firm extract. So although there is plenty of fruit there, it's the dry core that is evident. It could still soften, so wait until 2017 to drink.
title: Azamor 2010 Selected Vines Red (Alentejano)

description: This ripe and structured wine is poised between rich berry fruits and a solid, dark tannic core. It has great fruitiness that envelops the dry center, showing wood and spice flavors that are coming together well. Drink this fine wine from 2018.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2013 Ciconia Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and juicy, full of blueberry fruit flavors, very smooth and velvet while also shot through with acidity. A delicious, ripe wine that is ready to drink now.
title: Casa de Santa Vitoria 2008 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This second wine from Dão Sul's Douro quinta shows the bright fruity side of the region. It's a lively, fresh, red fruit flavored wine, with soft tannins and a ready to drink feel.
designation: Quinta das Tecedeiras Flor de Tecedeiras
title: Dão Sul 2008 Quinta das Tecedeiras Flor de Tecedeiras Red (Douro)

description: Powerful tannins push the wine forward to a more fruity, spicy hinterland, where the red cherry acidity prevails.
title: Sanguinhal 2008 Quinta de São Francisco Red (Obidos)

description: Here's a ripe, earthy wine that is softly tannic and richly fruity. It has a fine balance between the warm blackberry fruits and solid structure. Made to be drunk young, it is already delicious. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a spicy wine that is full of juicy red-berry fruit notes. It is soft and gentle, with a core of dry tannins that gives the wine structure. Young and fruity, it is ready to drink, but will also age. Drink until 2018.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2011 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Red (Tejo)

description: Rounded and smooth, this generous blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah, is rich and perfumed. It has an immediately appealing ripe and fruity character, with plenty of black fruit and dark cherry tones supported by juicy acidity. Solid and chunky, this wine needs to age and would be best after 2016.
title: Herdade Paço do Conde 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a smooth and generous wine. It is rich, full-bodied and packed with dark plum flavor, but it's the ripe, velvet character that is so appealing. It's almost ready to drink, although the firm tannins and minerality at the end suggest it will be better from 2016.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Red (Douro)

description: This is firm and solid wine is a blend dominated by tannic Touriga Nacional. Ripe berry fruits on the palate offer juicy acidity for balance, and a perfumed hue gives character and nuance. This impressive wine needs to age, so wait until 2016.
title: Quinta do Monte d'Oiro 2009 Aurius Red (Lisboa)

description: From a blend of grapes that includes Touriga Nacional, this wine is serious and dense. It has a solid texture along with concentrated dark-plum flavors. It's a powerhouse of firm tannins, juicy fruits and a fine layer of spice from wood aging. Drink after 2015.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Ramos Premium Red (Alentejano)

description: Merlot and Syrah join Tinta Roriz in this impressive wine. A fermentation in open lagars as well as time in oak give this blend richness and a deliciously juicy. Ripe and full bodied, it is ready to drink.
title: Campolargo 2008 Vinha da Costa Red (Bairrada)

description: This is a big, ripe and fruity wine. It is now maturing well into a rich, solid, complex wine. This second wine from the Mouchão estate in Alentejo is gorgeous, opulent and rich. The black fruit character is powerful, with delicious acidity and a darkly tannic character. It is still very young, so drink from 2017.
title: Mouchão 2009 Ponte das Canas Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: DFJ Vinhos manages this 16th century property which has produced a now mature wine. It has great balance, the berry fruits moving to secondary flavors of spice, smokiness, sweet tannins and hints of toast. It's ready to drink, but will continue to develop through 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Quinta do Rocio Red (Lisboa)

description: This is an open, soft, ripe and fruity wine. With a finely integrated tannic structure and plenty of red fruits and acidity, it is a generous full wine that is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Lab Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This ripe and fruity wine is as reliable as always. With soft tannins and generous red-berry flavors, it is an attractive blend of Touriga Nacional and Syrah which have been infused with Alentejo warmth. Drink now.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Defesa do Esporão Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Alentejano)

description: Earthy aromas are a hallmark of the Baga grape, a component of this full-bodied, tannic blend. With weight and richness, a mint note and new wood flavors, it is a serious wine that still should develop over three years.
title: Caves Aliança 2007 Quinta das Baceladas Red (Bairrada)

description: Very dark in color, this is an impressive wine with power and dense tannins. The fruit is solid, packed with blackberry and dark plum flavors, and wild, almost savage, ripeness.
title: Calços do Tanha 2005 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Fresh, despite the dense tannin, this is a ripe, juicy wine, full of black currant flavors and vibrant acidity. Wood treatment shows more cassis just at the end to round the wine out.
title: Cálem 2006 Curva Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The minerality that seems to come from this quinta makes for a wine that needs time, and this wine is defiantly young. However, its chocolate flavors, bitter toast and dense structure all promise well.
title: CARM 2006 Quinta do Coa Red (Douro)

description: Gently wood aged, the wine is rich in tannins and with generous red fruits. It is ripe with pepper as well as red-fruit flavors. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Opta 2016 Red (Dão)

description: This is a soft wine with open fruits and gentle tannins. A blend of local varieties along with Syrah, the wine is smoothly textured, generous and ready to drink.
title: Perescuma 2016 Terra Brava Red (Alentejano)

description: This new range of wines from Lagoalva features typical Portuguese tiles (azulejos) on the label. Inside the bottle, this wine is fruity with soft tannins, spice and red-berry flavors. It has a juicy aftertaste that blends with the fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Lagoalva de Cima 2015 Lagoalva Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This soft ripe wine is smooth and velvet textured. Its black fruits and ripe tannins are well integrated with the acidity and juicy aftertaste. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira, Petit Verdot and Alicante Bouschet is eclectic but certainly works. Ready to drink now.
title: Global Wines 2016 Monte da Cal Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This rich blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional and Alfrocheiro is all fruit without any oak aging. That gives the wine a ripe black-fruit character, balanced with acidity and a light touch of spice. Drink this attractive wine now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2016 Pouca Roupa Red (Alentejano)

description: The estate is owned by the Olazabal family, descendants of Antonia Ferreira who created this and many other estates in the 19th century. This is a major wine, ripe and full of rich tannins and concentrated fruit. It is always one of the longest-lived wines from the Douro and this vintage has the structure and the fruit weight to develop well. An attractive spicy, smoky character adds extra interest. Drink from 2022.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2014 Red (Douro)

description: Always impressive, this wine is structured and powerful, with firm tannins that are still coming together. Packed with black fruits and tannins, it conveys a rich, almost Port-like quality, perhaps because the grapes are foot-trodden as in Port. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 Vinha da Francisca Red (Douro)

description: A big-hearted, fruity wine. With its ripe tannins and red berry fruits, this red is certainly powerful, but it manages to keep its balance, finishing ripe and sweet. This is a wine that could be enjoyed now, but would certainly age over the next 4–5 years.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2005 Red (Douro)

description: Big, rich and fruity, this wine has a powerful future. It delivers structure and dense tannins, but it's the generous fruitiness that promises much. The tannins will soften by 2016–2017 to give a ripe, full-bodied wine, packed with fruit.
title: Terras de Alter 2011 Terra D'Alter Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: From vineyards in the Douro Superior, the high Douro close to Spain, this powerful wine reflects the dry climate with its dense tannins and concentration. A juicy element brings fresh black plums and acidity to the mix. The wine is an impressive work in progress. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2011 Passagem Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A fresh and rich wine, its tannins soft and smooth. There is a firm edge, while the main flavors are ripe, juicy black plum and damsons, pushed by final acidity.
title: Douro Family Estates 2007 DFE Premium Red (Douro)

description: There is a rich blend of Aragonez, Touriga Nacional, Trincadeira and Syrah in this full, ripe, black-fruit tinged wine. It is already open and generous, with wood spice tones and a smooth texture. Drink now through 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2012 Mariana Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a powerful wood-aged wine that is currently exhibiting dark chocolate and coffee flavors from new, smoky oak. It's the weight of the juicy fruit underneath that reveals the promise of aging. There is a mineral texture that shows the schist soil of the vineyard, all part of the dense mix. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2010 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: This earthy wine has black-currant acidity, awkward dry tannins and a tough texture. The aftertaste is medicinal and herbal.
title: Valle Pradinhos 2010 Porta Velha Red (Trás-os-Montes)

description: With soft tannins and ripe berry fruits, this is an immediately accessible wine. It has a fresh character, with a smoky edge and a ripe, smooth aftertaste. This would make a great barbecue wine for the summer.
title: Aveleda 2014 Charamba Red (Douro)

description: Rich, generous and packed with fruit, this is a field-blend wine that just bursts from the glass. With a fine balance between tannins and the rich blackberry fruits, the wine is ripe, warm and structured. It is a wine to age, so drink from 2020.
title: Conceito Vinhos 2015 Conceito Red (Douro)

description: In the increasingly important Dão region, Sobral's top-of-the-range is an impressively rich dense wine. With its great tannins and generous black fruits, it is full of potential. Produced by winemaker Carlos Lucas from a selection of grapes as well as parcels, the wine is concentrated, dark and firm. The acidity gives it great life as well as a juicy character that emphasizes the ripe fruit. The wine is still young, drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Sobral 2014 Vinha da Neta Red (Dão)

description: A strongly wood aged wine, powered by tannins and dense fruits, it is concentrated and still young enough for the wood to show through although the fruit is developing well. This is a structured wine that will need plenty of time to age so drink from 2018.
title: Adega de Favaios 2012 Casa Velha Colheita Seleccionada Red (Douro)

description: This is a finely integrated, rich wine that shows impeccable balance between dusty tannins and juicy dark berry tones. The wood aging shows through in a smooth texture that gives a sense of richness to the ripe fruit. This is an elegant wine that can be drunk now although it will benefit from some aging. Drink from 2017.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2013 Periquita Reserva Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Despite its richness, this is a stylish wine that exudes freshness as much as dense fruit and structure. A blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon, all structured varieties, it still yields a generous full-bodied and rounded wine. It does need to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2012 Maria Mora Enamorada Red (Alentejano)

description: A lean style bringing out acidity from the juicy black currant fruits. It has definite tannins supporting the fruit, while it finishes with fresh, perhaps too fresh, acidity.
title: J. & F. Lurton 2008 Barco Negro Red (Douro)

description: Going for structure as much as fruit, this is a cool wine with black currant flavors giving high acidity. It feels light, fresh, although there are tannins and spice to give some final weight.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2007 Bridão Classico Red (Ribatejo)

description: From limestone and granite soils, this is a structured, mineral, textured wine. It already has a fine balance between berry fruits and their acidity and a dense, dry tannic core that gives the wine a solid character and considerable potential. Drink from 2018.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2013 Red (Alentejano)

description: This wood-aged wine is a product of the new venture Sogrape has launched in Alentejo. It is powerful, dark in color and seriously concentrated. Dense tannins and a solid structure are rich with black plum and berry fruits as well as acidity. The wine is still young and needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Sogrape 2013 Herdade do Peso Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: The wine comes from the Guedes family's showpiece estate for Casa Ferreirinha in the Alto Douro. It is dark, dense and still very young. With a strong mineral element and dry tannins, it has concentration as well as potential. The black plum fruits are still developing, still youthful. So give this impressive wine until 2020 before drinking.
title: Casa Ferreirinha 2013 Quinta da Leda Red (Douro)

description: Spicy and juicy, this is obviously a wood-aged wine. It offers tannins, red fruits, coffee and a warm, rich character balanced by acidity that cuts through the structure. It needs some aging, so drink from 2016.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Atlântico Gold Label Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: A bold, powerful wine, showing smooth, mature black-fruit flavors and rich tannins. It is soft, solid and powerfully built. Wood aging has given extra roundness and a touch of spice to the palate. Drink this wine now and until 2018.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2007 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Solid tannins lead into a wine that balances very dry, dark fruits with dense wood textures. It's a solid, chunky, bold wine, richly fruity and still young. Drink this firm, ageworthy wine from 2016.
title: Poças 2011 Vale de Cavalos Red (Douro)

description: This is a strongly mineral wine, textured and rich at the same time, with fine acidity. Blackberry fruit dominates the palate, with rich tannins and cool freshness. It tastes of terroir, a true Dão from the granite soils. Drink from 2016.
title: Casa da Passarella 2009 Somontes Reserva Red (Dão)

description: The lightest wine from Cartuxa, EA stands for Eugénio de Almeida, the creator of the charity that owns the winery. It's simple and fruity, with attractive tannins and red cherry fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Cartuxa 2010 EA Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine has a fat fruity texture along with acidity and plenty of tannins. It is austere in character, very dry and dense and with a serious intent. There is a juicy aftertaste that is more attractive and has promise for the future.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Andreza Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A classic Douro blend of Touriga Nacional, Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz makes a harmonious wine that has ripe berry fruits and a soft structure. It is a stylish wine with a fresh fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Colleja
title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Colleja Red (Douro)

description: Some slightly sappy elements mingle with cinnamon and blackberries in the aromas of this complex red. Anise and cherry flavors appear on the palate, along with mild bitter chocolate on the finish. Lots of interesting things here in this medium-weight, food-friendly wine.
title: Calços do Tanha 1996 Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Time in oak has given this wine great depth and richness. Its tannins are finely integrated into the spice and black fruit flavors. Solid and concentrated, it is going to develop into a serious pour. Drink from 2017.
title: Evel 2011 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is big, ripe, chocolate and dark-fruit flavored wine that shows concentrated tannins and dense wood. Blackberry tones are starting to push through to give this impressive wine balance and a serious future. Drink from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2013 Romeira Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Firm and structured, this has dense tannins as well as fruity character. Both the texture and the black plum fruits are concentrated. Flavors of wood aging have smoothed out the naturally stalky character of the fruit. Drink from 2016.
title: Casca Wines 2012 Cape Roca Lighthouse Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A wonderful, rich wine, fermented in open stone lagars, giving a concentrated, beautifully soft wine. The texture is dense and velvety; ripe black fruits are given further complexity by wood aging. A superb wine, powerful and elegant.
title: Vinha Paz 2007 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Rui Reguinga, named Portugal's Winemaker of the Year in 2009, produces this sumptuous wine. The fruit is rich, with jammy berries and plums, balanced with spice from wood aging. The core of tannins suggests a powerful wine that will age well.
title: Quinta do Quetzal 2007 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: His skills show in this rich, powerful, finely balanced wine. It has layers of black berry fruits, damsons, bitter chocolate and a good core of acidity. Give this impressive wine 3–4 years.
title: Luis Duarte 2008 Rapariga da Quinta Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Rich, but structured and balanced, this is a wine that has delicious swathes of ripe blackberry and black plum. There is a touch of bitter extract, but this will integrate as the wine ages. The acidity goes well with the solid tannins. Drink from 2016.
title: Cooperativa Reguengos de Monsaraz 2011 Monsaraz Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: A firmly structured wine that boasts firm, dry tannins, rich black berry and plum fruits, and a hint of wood. This is deliciously ripe, juicy, packed with warm fruit flavors, sweet and rich.
title: Burmester 2006 Red (Douro)

description: This fruity wine is made to be drunk young. It has soft tannins, perfumed blackberry fruit and just enough acidity. Smoothly textured, it's a great barbecue-style of red. The wine is named after the vineyard rather than after the literal Portuguese meaning of “scantily dressed.” Drink now.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2015 Pouca Roupa Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This attractive wine is full of ripe fruit, with soft tannins and only light acidity. It is developing well. Drink this wine from late 2017.
title: Rozes 2013 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)

description: This is a ripe, impressively rich wine. With dense tannins, spice and layers of black fruits it is concentrated, wearing its high alcohol easily. It comes from one of the home estates of Casa Santos Lima in the heart of the Lisboa region. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Quinta do Espírito Santo Red (Lisboa)

description: Aged for 12 months in wood, this smooth, ripe wine is already rich and delicious. Its structure is well integrated into the berry fruits and acidity. It's ready to drink from 2018.
designation: Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Tinto
title: Luis Duarte 2015 Rapariga da Quinta Colheita Seleccionada Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a dark and dense wine that has solid perfumed fruits. The tannins, still dry, are partnered with blackberry fruits, spice and just a touch of wood. The wine needs to age, so wait until 2016.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: Concentrated tannins give this wine from organic grapes a powerful structure. For balance, it also has a more fruity character that offers blackberry and black plums. The dense texture means it needs to age until 2015.
title: Quinta do Romeu 2010 Red (Douro)

description: Just lightly structured, this is a delicious, fruity wine. With soft tannins and rounded black fruits, it's fresh and fragrant. Wood flavors support the fruitiness. Full-bodied and ripe, it's ready to drink.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Pancas Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine is ripe, generous and lightly structured. Black currant and black plum fruits surround a dry core that gives texture. It's not for long-term aging.
title: Herdade dos Coelheiros 2009 Tapada dos Coelheiros Red (Alentejano)

description: A smooth and fruity wine that has soft tannins and a rich, juicy character. It is full of damson and black plum fruits, ripe and jammy at the end. Drink now.
title: Barão de Vilar 2012 Red (Douro)

description: Named after the dovecote on the Vesuvio estate, this wine comes from low-yield vines. It is certainly concentrated while preserving plenty of open fruit. The black-cherry and blackberry flavors are combined with some firm dry tannins that will allow the wine to age further. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2015 Pombal do Vesuvio Red (Douro)

description: Dense and powerful, this is an impressively concentrated and intense wine. It brings out rich tannins, equally rich black plum and spice flavors, a layer of smokiness plus a strong slash of minerality that cuts across the texture. For aging 5–6 years.
title: Quinta do Portal 2006 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Ripe and spicy, this is an impressive, solid, new wood-dominated wine. The tannins come from high toast as well as the concentrated blackberry juice fruits. That makes it dry, a wine that needs to soften. But it has all the intensity that are the hallmarks of top Douro wines, so try it again in a year.
title: Dão Sul 2005 Quinta das Tecedeiras Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Blending Touriga Franca, Syrah and Alicante Bouschet, this is an attractive young wine. With both acidity and tannins already integrated into the ripe black fruit, it is a wine to drink young.
title: Terra Silvestre 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: With the smooth Touriga Franca and Tinta Roriz making up the body of this ripe wine, it has a generous, fruity character. The tannins are a support to this fine fruit and rich aftertaste. Drink this young wine now for its fruit or wait until 2018 for it to soften and round.
title: Casa de Cambres 2015 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: This wood-aged reserve wine has structure and fine dry tannins. Under that the black fruits are still developing. Give it another year in the cellar before drinking.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2014 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Rich and spicy, this complex blend holds Touriga Nacional, Trincadeira and Aragonez. It has juicy fruits and balanced tannins, black currant fruitiness and delicious acidity. With a touch of spice and an herbal backdrop, the wine is ripe and ready to go.
title: Lusovini 2011 Terras de Fialho Red (Alentejano)

description: Rich, structured while also juicy, this is a complex wine. A strongly mineral, steely character supports juicy berry fruits and ripe acidity. The wine is dry, but the great fruitiness gives it an attractive future. Drink from 2016.
title: Magnum Vinhos 2010 Ribeiro Santo Reserva Red (Dão)

description: There is a curious petrol aroma to this wine. Even so, the red berry flavor is attractive and fresh, and the acidity is lean.
title: Herdade dos Templários 2010 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Smooth wine, the wood aging underlaying the cherry and ripe plum fruit flavors. It is powerful, yes, although there is a great sense of style from the ripe fruit integrated into rich tannins and final acidity.
title: Poças 2008 Vale de Cavalos Red (Douro)

description: A firm wine, based on dry tannins and some dense fruit. It has acidity, driven by black berry flavors. The core of the wine is dry, both from wood and acidity, and it will benefit from 2–3 years' aging.
title: Quinta do Portal 2007 Mural Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Meandro, named after the horseshoe bend on the Douro that surrounds the Vale Meão vineyard, is the second wine from this quinta. In its own right, it is a fine wine, solidly based around smooth, rich black berry fruits and spice. Age for 5–6 years at least.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2008 Meandro do Vale Meão Red (Douro)

description: A dense wine with great spicy fruit, open and generous. This is a wine that feels powerful, structured and concentrated. It needs aging for at least 3–4 years.
title: Duorum 2009 Colheita Red (Douro)

description: Soft tannins and bright acidity give a wine that's ready to drink. Juicy red berry fruits dominate, with tannins just in the background.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2013 Chão das Rolas Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: Smooth and ripe, this is a softly textured, caramel-flavored wine. It does have a dry element, but the main thrust is full of juicy acidity. Ready to drink now.
title: Casal do Conde 2010 Terra Chã Red (Tejo)

description: A solid, tannic wine that has both great rich fruits and a dry core that needs to soften with age. It tastes powerful without sacrificing a perfumed and floral elegance. This is a serious wine, with a dense texture and potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Kopke 2011 Red (Douro)

description: This is a spicy, rich, smooth wine, immediately attractive and ready to drink. It has ripe tannins, black fruits in abundance and delicious acidity to give a lift. It's a classic barbecue wine and great for summer parties.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2009 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: The second label of Alorna, Portal da Aguia wines develop early. This bright and fruity red is based around soft tannins, very ripe fruits and a juicy, full-in-the-mouth texture. It needs little time to age, so drink from the end of 2014.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2011 Portal da Aguia Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This juicy, fruity wine comes from an estate once owned by the Knights Templar. Full of red berry flavors and acidity, it has a light touch along with a layer of tannins and signs of wood aging. It's likely to age quickly. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Herdade dos Templarios Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Totally mature, this shows a rustic character and firm, tarry tannins. It is weighty and dense, with a patina of sweet flavors that come with age. Drink it over the next few months.
title: Monte da Penha 2005 Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Soft, warm and lightly tannic, this has an herbaceous character. Its fresh acidity balances its black currant flavor. It is fragrant, fruity and mature; ready to drink.
title: Monte da Penha 2007 Montefino Red (Alentejano)

description: This big, spicy wine is dominated by licorice and heavy toast wood flavors. It is rich and full of black plum skins with only a hint of acidity. The aftertaste is sharp and bitter.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2010 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: Winemaker Francisco Olazabal, from Quinta do Vale Meão, produces this ripe, smoky wine from vineyards above the Douro River. Lab (as in Labrador) is fruity, with a cool element that brings in tannins as well as immediately attractive red fruits. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2012 Lab Premium Red (Douro)

description: Everything is in place in this structured wine that's packed with big berry fruits that give a delicious succulence. At the same time, the tannins offer richness and concentration. It's almost ready to drink.
designation: Quinta de São João Cuvée RB
title: Pinhal da Torre 2010 Quinta de São João Cuvée RB Red (Tejo)

description: This second wine from Quinta de Roriz is ripe, structured and rich with plum fruits and sweet tannins. Some minerality brings out the texture, but the main pleasure of this wine is the great smooth fruit. It's ready to drink, although it will be better from 2016.
title: Prats & Symington LDA 2012 Prazo de Roriz Red (Douro)

description: An earthy wine, with a strong herb and spice character. The fruit is fresh, laced with black currant acidity and soft tannins. A fine, food-friendly wine, ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Ventozelo 2009 Cister da Ribeira Red (Douro)

description: A Santos Lima estate-grown blend of Shiraz and Touriga Nacional, this is a ripe, spicy wine that shows its wood aging strongly. Rich tannins and red fruits are melded with acidity and a juicy, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Cigarra Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This has big red berry flavors along with intense acidity topped by the dark, dry tannic structure. It will need some aging, so drink from 2017.
title: Perescuma 2013 Orquestra Red (Alentejano)

description: With its classic blend of Douro grapes, this is a serious, structured wine from the heart of the valley. It has a leathery edge from dry tannins along with dense black fruit and wood aging flavors. It still needs cellaring, so drink from 2017.
title: Quinta das Carvalhas 2012 Red (Douro)

description: This is a powerful wine, although it wears its density easily. There is a streak of acidity that gives the wine its juicy, attractive character. Black fruits and firm tannins are equally to the fore along with a powerful, concentrated texture. The wine is still aging and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Ribafreixo 2012 Gáudio Clássico Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Soft, attractive wine whose lightness is belied by its 14% alcohol. That makes it balanced, the black cherry flavors well integrated with the easy tannins, light spice and acidity. Drink this year.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2009 Loios Red (Alentejano)

description: On the Atlantic coast, south of Lisbon, the Herdade da Comporta style is rich, soft wines, generous in their warm tannins. The 2007 shows ripe fruit, figs, chocolate and plum flavors and dense texture.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2007 Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: The structure is the thing here, a square, firmly tannic wine. The dry core of this impressive wine spreads out to the dark plum skin and loganberry flavors, solid and finely angled.
title: Vinha Paz 2008 Colheita Red (Dão)

description: Classic tannic Dão Touriga Nacional, packed with minerality, dark and dry tannins, firm and with a good juicy final character. Part of a range of wines from across the country under the name Azul Portugal.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2008 Azul Portugal Red (Dão)

description: A wine only made in the best years, this is rich, softly textured, opulent and ripe wine. It is a powerful statement of sweet plums, arabica coffee, dark tannins, immense rich concentration.
title: Monte do Pintor 2007 Escultor Red (Alentejano)

description: There is dense chocolate and sweet berry flavors in this still young wine, its complex density still working its way through the solid fruit flavors and richness. It is powerful, yet still elegant.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2006 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: A soft, earthy wine with light fruits and plum jelly flavors. It is a wine that should be drunk young to enjoy its balance of fruitiness, acidity and light tannins. Screwcap.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2010 Ciconia Red (Alentejano)

description: Ripe fruit, good, even high acidity, a touch of wood: everything is here, except for the nagging edge of rusticity that often pervades the Carmo estate wine. It needs more polish.
title: Quinta do Carmo 2004 Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is rich, possibly too rich with its dark tannins and tarry character. While there are plenty of black plum fruits, there is also some bitter licorice that comes from extraction during winemaking. Considering its age, it is likely this character will remain. The wine is ready to drink.
title: H. Abrantes Douro Wines 2011 LVW Red (Douro)

description: Named after the river that flows through the Dão region, this wine is powerful, concentrated and serious. Still young and full of tannins, it also has ripe black fruits and balancing acidity. The structure brings out the granite soil of the region, with its dark, brooding quality. This is a fine wine that needs to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Fontes da Cunha 2010 Quinta do Mondego Red (Dão)

description: Piled high with tannins, José Perdigão's dark, firm wine is structured and rich. A blend of 35% each of Tinta Roriz and Jaen, 20% Touriga Nacional and 10% Alfrocheiro enmeshed in new French barrels for 12 months, it shows black plum, dark chocolate and spice tones alongside bright acidity. It is still working its way through the dry core of tannins and will certainly be better to drink from 2019.
title: Quinta do Perdigão 2009 Red (Dão)

description: Vines in the Douro Superior, the remote area in the eastern edges of the Douro wine region, go into this firm wine. With its dry tannins and firm structure, the wine is always going to be powerful. It has spice and rich blackberry and damson fruits. The aftertaste brings in acidity. Drink this wine now, but don't forget to let it breathe for a couple of hours.
designation: Vinha da Urze Grande Reserva Tinto
title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2010 Vinha da Urze Grande Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)

description: Produced from a field blend of old vines (Vinhas Velhas), this rich wine is powerfully structured. It has dark tannins and great concentration, balancing rich plum flavors and acidity with firm structure. This is a wine for serious aging, don't drink before 2020.
designation: Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Especial
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Reserva Especial Red (Douro)

description: This is a structured wine, probably because of the Touriga Nacional in the blend. That also gives a perfumed edge to this ripe, full wine with its juicy red fruit acidity. It is fruity and will be ready to drink from late 2016.
title: Caves Velhas 2015 Casaleiro Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This is the entry-level wine at Passadouro, with generous fruits and black plum flavors. It has spice from the wood aging along with generous tannins that don't detract from the rich nature and open fruits. The aftertaste shows a wine that is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2013 Passa Red (Douro)

description: Although based in Bairrada, further south, Messias does have considerable interests in the Douro. This wine, with its firm, mineral structure, brings out the tannins and concentration of the Douro. That goes with the black fruit flavors that are dark and dry. Drink this wine now.
title: Messias 2013 Messias Selection Red (Douro)
