With some firm tannins and a tight texture it shows plenty of the schist terroir of the Douro. Over that there are layers of rich dark fruits that are balanced with acidity. Drink the wine now.
title: Van Zellers 2013 VZ Tinto Red (Douro)

description: This is a full, ripe, rich and structured wine. It brings out great fruitiness as well as a textured, dry and solid character. Balanced and concentrated,  this imposing wine needs a couple of years to develop. Drink from 2015.
title: Quinta da Alorna 2010 Portal da Aguia Tinto Red (Tejo)

description: This wine has a dry, solid character, with more tannins than fruit at this very young stage. Firm now, it will soften although its structure suggests it will likely continue to be a firm, structured wine for many years. Drink from 2020.
title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2014 Red (Douro)

description: It's a ripe wood-aged wine, showing a full body, dark plum flavors and generous tannins. It is maturing well, giving plenty of ripe fruits along with spice and a solid tannic aftertaste.
title: Altas Quintas 2007 Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a full-bodied and very ripe wine. It is dry, but has layers of sweet fruits, gentle tannins and suggestions of the wood aging. With spice, some herbal character and great fruitiness, it's ready to drink.
title: Herdade dos Machados 2011 Toutalga Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: With six months of oak aging, this wine has been smoothed, allowing the tannins to broaden out. Along with the blackberry-jelly flavor, the wine is rich while also structured. It needs a little time, so drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Douro)

description: From a small sub-region of Lisboa, this stylish, structured wine is firm and tannic. It has plenty of ripe berry fruit to balance the tannins as well as acidity that cuts through the richness of the wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: They say red Vinho Verde is an acquired taste, and with its very tight tannins and acidity, this wine fits the billing. Think of it with sardines or fatty meats.
title: Campelo 2009 Tinto Red (Vinho Verde)

description: Named CH (the initials for Switzerland) in honor of the Swiss origins of owner Alice Tavares da Silva, this wine is made from old vines. The wine has concentration and generous tannins that are as bold as the black fruits. It is still very young, still with its young licorice flavors. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Quinta de Chocapalha 2012 CH by Chocapalha Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a rich, impressive, age-worthy wine. With firm tannins and sumptuous juicy black fruits, it shows no sign of its high alcohol. It blends structure and fruit easily. The wine is named to celebrate the second Lança generation in charge at the estate. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade Grande 2012 Gerações Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: From the producer's own vineyards in the Douro, this is a rich wine with plenty of firm tannins and a strongly mineral character. It has juicy red fruits that are balanced by acidity. The structure and dense tannins promise aging. Drink from 2018.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2014 Domini Red (Douro)

description: The wine is dark and dense although with a sense of freshness provided by the blackberry fruit. There are spices from the wood aging and firm dry tannins. It is a concentrated wine that will be better to drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Premium Red (Alentejo)

description: Named after a local aristocrat, this wine is soft, fruity and fresh. Red berry fruits are light and crisp. Behind them, gentle tannins give a hint of structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2014 Visconde de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: This is gentle and soft with red berry fruits and some (possibly not enough) acidity. It's rounded and smooth, touched by caramel from short wood aging. Drink now.
title: Adega de Cantanhede 2012 Marquês de Marialva Colheita Seleccionada Red (Bairrada)

description: This is a cool, light wine. It has stalky black fruits and tannins that come from the fruit skins. It is a wine to drink almost as an apéritif: light and fruity at the end.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Coreto Tinto Red (Lisboa)

description: Named “new world” to recognize Portugal's great contribution to discovery, the wine itself is more traditional. It is a ripe blend of local varieties, fully integrated with black currant fruits and just a hint of a dry core of tannins. Drink now.
title: Enoport 2014 Novo Mondo Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: This is a rustic, soft wine. It has red fruits and acidity along with light tannins and a barnyard character that is not unpleasant. Drink now.
title: Casal da Coelheira 2013 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo)

description: Situated close to the picturesque hilltop town of Obidos, this quinta has produced a ripe full-bodied wine. With bold red fruits, juicy acidity and a layer of tannins, the wine is both generous and fruity. It will be ready to drink from late 2017.
title: Sanguinhal 2014 Quinta de S. Francisco Red (Obidos)

description: This is a serious, impressive wine. Fermented in open stone tanks and wood aged, it has a rich texture that encompasses the ripe black fruits and the spicy tannins. The wine has real depth and concentration with a firm, dense structure that will allow it to age. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2012 Esporão Private Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: A dark, brooding style of tannic Douro wine. It is lean initially, with a strong mineral character and firm black plum-skin flavors plus leather and tight acidity. When it opens out, this becomes a great value from the Douro.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2005 Vega Red (Douro)

description: This ripe, raisin- and perfumed black fruit-flavored wine shows dusty tannin character as well as intriguingly old-fashioned leather and high acidity. In a traditional mold, this works deliciously, making it a fine food wine.
title: Herdade Grande 2004 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: The reserve version of this wine has extra richness and concentration. Solid tannins are filled out with ripe juicy blackberry fruits and perfumed acidity. The wine is concentrated and could age for a few more months. Drink from 2017.
title: Aveleda 2013 Charamba Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Aged in wood for up to 14 months, this wine is rich and smooth. Produced from low-yielding old vines, it's a field blend of many different varieties. It is ripe with layers of black currant and spice flavors along with acidity. The wine has weight but remains stylish. Drink from 2018.
designation: Vale da Poupa Reserva Field Blend
title: Secret Spot Wines 2014 Vale da Poupa Reserva Field Blend Red (Douro)

description: If you haven't tried Portuguese wines before, this impressively rich wine is a good place to start. Aging for three years, with 12 months in wood, gives it a smooth, ripe black-fruit character. The acidity and the fruit are a seamless part of the texture of the tannins. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2014 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is concentrated and structured. With dark tannins and bitter-chocolate flavors, it is dense with a ripe texture as well as big black fruits. It comes from a vineyard selection, yielding a powerful wine that needs another year to be ready. Wait until 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Created to celebrate the 500th anniversary of the birth of Saint Theresa of Avila, this wine made from a special selection of fruit. Richly structured, it displays great style as well as intensity. Black fruits are beautifully integrated into the ripe body of the wine, backed by acidity and with tannins and wood-aging flavors in the background. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Santa Teresa d'Avila Homenagem Red (Tejo)

description: In Latin, “Amantis” means a lover. The Quinta do Carmo estate was given by a king of Portugal to his lover, Dona Maria. This hugely tannic wine has impressive, rich fruits based around Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Petit Verdot and Touriga Nacional.
title: Dona Maria-Júlio Bastos 2006 Dona Maria Amantis Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: Rich, rounded, smooth, with cocoa and espresso flavors giving a touch of bitterness. It is a wine with power that is still young. Impressive, with its broad black fruits. Keep for 4–5 years.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2007 Private Collection Red (Alentejano)

description: A fine, ripe wine, fully structured with its tannins supported by delicious red fruits. It has concentration and a generous feel to it, showing warmth as well as a strong line in acidity. The wine finishes with spice, fruit, and tannins in the background.
title: Casaleiro 2012 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Castelão-Trincadeira Red (Tejo)

description: Ripe, rich and smooth, this wine has structure under the generous, opulent black fruits that will allow it to age further. But with its succulent character laced with acidity, it is surprisingly ready to drink for such a young wine.
title: Calheiros Cruz 2013 Madalena Reserva Especial Red (Douro)

description: Full of tannins and with the potential of ripe fruit, this wine is young, concentrated and powerful. The alcohol does show as a burn of pepper at the end, spoiling an otherwise well-balanced wine. Produced from a 200-acre vineyard in the Douro Superior, the wine should be ready from 2019.
title: Quinta das Bandeiras 2014 Passagem Red (Douro)

description: This juicy, fruity wine also brings a firm structure to bear. It is rich, friendly and ready to drink soon. Keep for a few months for the tannins to fill out.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2012 Periquita Original Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: A blend of northern and southern Portuguese grapes, this is a seriously firm wine that's structured and dense. Spiced black plums are layered with big, drying tannins and acidity, which promise long aging for this impressive wine. Drink from 2017.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2009 Francos Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This is a solid and dark wine, full of black fruits and dense tannins. It has weight and richness, as well as a leather and smoke character that comes from the wood aging. A powerful wine for aging, drink from 2017.
title: Quinta do Pinto 2011 Estate Collection Red (Lisboa)

description: This dense, black-colored wine throws great weight around. It's firmly concentrated, with stylish elegance from perfectly ripe black-currant fruits. Dark and lush, it finishes with soft acidity. It could benefit from several years aging, so drink from 2017.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2010 Domini Red (Douro)

description: This wine is now mature with firm tannins and spicy wood and fruit flavors. The edge of Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional in the blend has given the wine its shape and concentration. Drink this fine wine from 2019.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2012 Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Named after the convent of Tomar, a home to the medieval Knights Templar (now a national monument), this is a ripe structured wine that benefits from the Cabernet Sauvignon and Touriga Nacional in the blend. Full and rich and with the ability to age, the wine is serious and full of fruit. Drink now.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2013 Convento Tomar Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: High in acidity, this wine seems unbalanced. The fruit is distinct from the structure, leaving crispness contrasted with firm tannins.
title: Félix Rocha 2012 Quinta de São Cristóvão Red (Lisboa)

description: Spicy and fruity, this soft-edged wine has delicious, warm blackberry jelly flavors that are lightly touched by tannins and acidity. An easy wine, ready to drink now.
title: Coteaux da Murta 2011 Murta Red (Lisboa)

description: The wine displays plenty of the warmth of Alentejo while keeping a streak of fresh black currant fruitiness. It's soft, generous and ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2010 Vega Red (Alentejano)

description: The wine is very dry and hard edged. It has an extracted, tough structure that seems to miss out on fruit. As it develops, it's likely to remain dry.
title: Messias 2011 Messias Selection Red (Douro)

description: Red fruits are what drive this easy, fragrant wine. The tannins play a supporting role, which gives the berry flavors structure. A blend from two Douro estates, this attractive selection will be ready to drink in a year.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2010 Duas Quintas Red (Douro)

description: Named for the air currents that allow birds to float above the Douro, this wine is ripe, full and soft. The wood shows quite strongly at this stage, and another year's aging will bring out the black currant note further.
title: Symington Family Estates 2010 Altano Red (Douro)

description: It seems quite right to call the grape Shiraz rather than Syrah in this blend, because the wine has a ripe, sweetly fruity style reminiscent of Australia. It is broad and full of black fruit, laced with acidity and finished with a warm edge of tannin.
title: Falua 2011 Tagus Creek Shiraz and Trincadeira Red (Tejo)

description: Named after a local aristocrat, this wine is soft, fruity and fresh. Red berry fruits are light and crisp. Behind them, gentle tannins give a hint of structure. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Marcolino Sebo 2014 Visconde de Borba Red (Alentejo)

description: The Algarve, in Portugal's south, is less known for its wines than as a holiday destination. This wine, with its blend of the familiar varieties (also found elsewhere in the country), is structured with red-berry flavors and tannins. The smooth texture and balanced acidity show it is ready to drink now.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2016 Al-Ria Red (Algarve)

description: A fine and elegant wine, flavors of blackberry and spice to go with the bright acidity. It has a fine layer of dusty, dry tannins that flesh out the fruit, along with a great final swathe of fresh fruit.
title: Douro Family Estates 2006 Bajancas Red (Douro)

description: Produced from a selection of old vines, the wine is structured and dense. It has powerful tannins that are integrated with the dark black fruits and mineral acidity. This is a serious, concentrated wine, solid with its firm structure and with a good future. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2012 Reserva Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: A ripe blend of Touriga Nacional and Castelão, the wine is balanced with considerable acidity from the Castelão and structure from the Touriga. It is only just beginning to mature while red berry and red currant fruit flavors still shine out. Drink now and until 2020.
title: Campolargo 2010 Termão Red (Bairrada)

description: Cool and tight, this is a firmly tannic wine, showing its mineral, primal rock character. The structure is dry, solid, the fruit a layer of cranberry and black fig among all this firmness. It should age, but is ready now.
designation: Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo
title: Companhia das Quintas 2005 Quinta do Cardo Selecção do Enólogo Red (Beira Interior)

description: This blend of Syrah and Touriga Nacional is rustic with some hard tannins and intense acidity. Since it is still young, the wine could soften but it seems to be more about its structure than its fruit.
title: Santos & Santos 2015 Quinta da Cidadoura Red (Lisboa)

description: Great swathes of black fruit, coffee and sweet tannins give this ripe and juicy wine plenty of character and attractiveness. For immediate drinking.
title: José Maria da Fonseca 2008 Periquita Reserva Red (Setubal)

description: An easygoing ripe red, with the minerality of the Dão rounded into sweeter damson and red berry fruits. There's an attractive layer of acidity for freshness. Drink now.
title: Caves Aliança 2008 Aliança Particular Red (Dão)

description: Juicy Castelão fruit propels this wine, giving spice, soft tannins and ripe red cherries. It is full, very accessible, its acidity adding an attractive edge of freshness. Drink now, or age a year.
title: Bacalhôa Wines of Portugal 2008 Meia Pipa Red (Setubal)

description: Full-bodied, rounded and soft wine. It has plenty of ripe plum and spice flavors along with an edge of toast. Attractive, juicy wine for drinking now.
title: Caves Velhas 2010 Romeira Red (Alentejano)

description: A selection of the best parcels of Petit Verdot and Alicante Bouschet, this wine is dense and powerful. The wood aging is still showing strongly among the concentrated tannins and firm structure. The fruit weight and the general richness of this impressive wine will allow it to mature well. Drink from 2019.
title: Quinta de São Sebastião 2013 2 Tintos Petit Verdot-Alicante Bouschet Red (Alentejano)

description: This producer is the only grower of Caladoc grapes in Portugal, and one of the few in the world. Blended here with Tinta Roriz, the grape gives a ripe, soft and perfumed wine. It has a generous character, all fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2015 Paxis Red (Lisboa)

description: This powerful ripe wine is full bodied and concentrated, with young tannins and rich berry fruits. It comes from a single vineyard high on the hill above the estate house. With its structure still intact, it will take time to develop. Drink from 2021.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2013 Monte Meão Red (Douro)

description: Concentrated and powerful, this wine comes from one of the grandest estates in the Douro, now owned by the Symington family. Full of rich fruit along with layers of firm tannins, it is solid, dark and will age well, giving an impressive wine from 2020.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2014 Red (Douro)

description: While the wine has considerable power and richness, it is the fresh character that's most noticeable. The firm tannins and dark structure are shot through with black currant acidity and fresh berry fruits. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2012 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Ripe, juicy and spicy, this is already surprisingly delicious considering its solid, dark structure. Black fruits burst out, along with a sweet-and-sour character from acidity and ripe fruit flavor. It is also a good wine for aging, so drink through 2022.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2010 Esporão Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This perfumed old-vine field blend is rich and stylish. It has weight without power, a fine combination of lively red fruit and firm tannins, and will age well for years. Drink from 2019.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Lua Cheia em Vinhas Velhas Red (Douro)

description: A 50-50 blend of Touriga Nacional and Alicante Bouschet, this is rich and smooth. Its tannins provide a backbone of structure to its ripe, concentrated blackberry fruit. Ready to drink.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2014 Bridão Private Collection Red (Tejo)

description: From a small sub-region of Lisboa, this stylish, structured wine is firm and tannic. It has plenty of ripe berry fruit to balance the tannins as well as acidity that cuts through the richness of the wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Quinta das Setencostas Red (Alenquer)

description: This is a well-balanced blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira and Syrah. With its straight line in black fruits, dark tannins and lively acidity, it shows a fine structure and a good future. Touches of leather, chocolate and the wood aging all add interest. Drink from 2017.
title: Herdade de São Miguel 2012 Pimenta Preta Red (Alentejano)

description: This smooth, rich wine exudes southern warmth. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Aragonez and Alicante Bouschet gives a ripe, dark-colored wine dominated by black fruits. Tannins and acidity provide happy support. Drink now.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Colheita Red (Alentejano)

description: This open, fruity wine is named after Cape Bojador in the western Sahara, which Portuguese sailors rounded in the 15th century on their way around Africa. The wine's red fruits and acidity are easy, ripe and with a juicy aftertaste.
title: Espaço Rural 2016 Bojador Red (Alentejano)

description: This wine is rich and packed with black fruits. The soft texture and ripe fruitiness mean the tannins will soon fully integrate. Drink from 2018.
title: Herdade do Rocim 2016 Mariana Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Aragonez (aka Tempranillo) give this wine a fine balance between structure and fruitiness. While the alcohol suggests power, in fact it's the freshness and attractive red berry fruits that dominate. The wine is soft and ready to drink.
title: Herdade do Esporão 2014 Arco do Esporão Red (Alentejo)

description: With ripe fruit and a light layer of tannins, this is a fruity wine, packed with red fruits and black cherry flavors. It has a dusty background that will allow it to age for a few more months. Drink from the end of 2016.
title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Convento do Tomar Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: A structured, finely balanced wine that has intense acidity, blackberry fruits and soft, well-integrated tannins. It is ripe while remaining fresh, stylish and poised. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta do Portal 2013 Mural Red (Douro)

description: The heavy bottle is the giveaway here—it shouts important wine. It does live up to its billing, with black, brooding fruits and tannins, and a dense core of dusty tannins, brightened with acidity. There is a final firm and spicy aftertaste.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2007 Passadouro Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This is a rich wine, full of rounded black fruits and soft tannins. It is a young style of wine with no wood aging, just the ripe fruits. Drink this wine now.
title: Casa Santa Vitória 2014 Versátil Tinto Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a bold, ripe wine from the heart of the Alentejo. Perfumed, full of red berry flavored fruits and with a rich, soft texture, it is ready to drink.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2014 Monte Alentejano Red (Alentejano)

description: The wood aging shows strongly in this spicy wine. Besides bitter tannins it also gives the wine a minty character. It is young and hopefully the fruit will develop more and fill out this structure.
title: Casa de Cambres 2014 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: The Lapa vineyards are away from the Tagus (Tejo) river giving better structured soil and therefore firmer wines. That shows in this ripe wine with its tannins and bold fruits. It is attractively fruity, with a dry core. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Quinta da Lapa 2014 Selection Red (Tejo)

description: This wine comes from one of the grand aristocratic estates that line the eastern bank of the Tagus (Tejo) river. With ripe berry fruits, it shows signs of generous tannins as well as plenty of acidity. The wine is fruity, likely to age quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: Grande Reserva represents the very best selection from a vintage. This concentrated, dark wine has a brooding quality that shows both its quality and its aging ability. It is packed with plum and berry fruits that are still integrating with the solid tannins. It needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Quinta dos Aciprestes 2011 Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: Released after the 2011 vintage, this elegant wine has great presence. A blend of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca, if offers vibrant, structured fruit while still reserving its full glory for several more years. Ripe fruits blend with intense acidity at the end. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Romaneira 2010 Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This limited release wine is complex, dense and structured on the palate. It offers a lively contrast between perfumed black fruit and structured tannins, which should integrate well with further aging. Drink this serious wine from 2017.
title: Caves Velhas 2010 Cabeça de Toiro Special Selection Red (Tejo)

description: Named after João Maria, born in 2004, this Cabernet/Syrah blend is a dark, solid wine, a powerhouse of new wood, dry tannins and a burst of juicy, black, intense fruits. It has a touch of pepper as well as perfumed, polished wood and final spice. Produced in half bottles and magnums.
title: Herdade da Malhadinha Nova 2007 Peqeuno João Red (Alentejano)

description: Ripe and smooth, with mature velvet texture, figs, milk chocolate and ripe plums. Hints of wood aging are there, but they blend easily with the rich fruit.
title: J. Portugal Ramos 2005 Marquês de Borba Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: The wine is full of acidity and with stalky fruit. There is a sharp edge that detracts from the otherwise fruity character of this light crisp wine. This is ready to drink now.
title: Vinihold 2015 Altimo Red (Douro)

description: The Borba cooperative is in one of the most productive Alentejo wine regions. With this simple and fruity wine, it has captured warmth as well as ripe tannins. Berry fruits and acidity give it a lift. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2015 Brado Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a young fruity wine. It has attractive red-berry fruits and gentle tannins that are surrounded by the comfortable full-bodied texture. It's a wine to drink now.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte
title: Santos & Santos 2016 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Red (Alentejano)

description: This generous smooth wine is packed with ripe tannins and vibrant red fruits. There is the typical mineral texture of many Dão wines along with solid spice and dark chocolate flavors from wood aging. This is an impressive wine that deserves to age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Opta 2014 Opta Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Produced in Estremoz by the Serrano Mira family, this rich wine is dense with dark tannins and a powerful structure. This concentration is surrounded by bold ripe berry fruits and acidity that give the wine its richness aided by the wood aging. Drink this finely structured wine from late 2018.
title: Herdade das Servas 2014 Colheita Seleccionada Red (Alentejano)

description: This is not a shy wine—it is concentrated and powerful, with ripe tannins and dense black fruits. Coming from vineyards in the Douro Superior, this shows the region's the heat and harsh growing conditions, giving a compact, firm wine with a mineral texture to balance the juicy fruits. It will need several years, so drink from 2017.
title: Companhia das Quintas 2012 Quinta da Fronteira Reserva Red (Douro)

description: A soft and ripe wine with juicy Alicante Bouschet dominating the open fruity blend. It is immediately drinkable with just enough acidity to give the wine a crisp (although still rich) aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Coudel Mor Classico Red (Tejo)

description: While the wine is young, it is made in a style that makes it very ready to drink. The tannins are so soft, with rounded black fruits just crispened by acidity. Drink now.
title: Tapada de Villar 2016 Tinto Red (Alentejo)

description: This is a soft ready-to-drink wine. It has light tannins, a mineral edge and stalky black-currant fruits. It is attractively accessible now.
title: Quinta da Rede 2015 Red (Douro)

description: Paxis is a warm, earthy wine, packed with ripe, soft and forward fruit. It does have a structure that could allow the wine to age, but there is no need as its fruitiness makes it ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Paxis Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a lightly textured wine with acidity and some firm tannins. It has a fruity character, red berry flavors and attractive acidity. The wine, balanced and generous, is ready to drink.
title: Casa S.M. de Tourais 2013 São Matias Red (Dão)

description: A ripe and elegant wine, full of sweet fruits, laced with tannins. It has an attractive tar and plum set of flavors, firmly anchored in its central core of dryness.
title: Quinta do Carneiro 2007 Reserva Red (Alenquer)

description: Dominated by the Trincadeira and Aragonez grapes, this is a super-smooth, ripe wine from northeast Alentejo. Oak aging has rounded out the tannins, with generous red fruit driving the palate. Already completely integrated, this wine needs no further aging to be pleasantly enjoyed.
title: Monte da Penha 2009 Reserva Red (Alentejano)

description: This is a rich, wood-aged wine, with smoky aromas and a strong spiciness. On the palate, the wine is ripe, full of black fruits and firm tannins. The blend of Touriga Nacional, Aragonez and Syrah has a fine perfumed character, with generous structure and delicious acidity. Drink after 2015.
title: Quinta Vale do Armo 2011 Vale do Armo Reserva Red (Tejo)

description: Rich and finely balanced, this wine combines spice notes with rich tannins and blackberry tones. While it is dense and complex, it is still young and needs time to age. Drink after 2015.
title: Campolargo 2010 Diga? Tinto Red (Bairrada)

description: The wine is soft, smooth and full of rich berry fruits. The blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira and Alicante Bouschet gives a warm southern feel: ripe wine, sunshine and soft tannins. Wood aging has smoothed the bold fruits and created a full generous aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Herdade da Comporta 2014 Private Selection Red (Península de Setúbal)

description: A generous blend of Alicante Bouschet, Touriga Nacional, Aragonez and Syrah, this is firm with tannins and packed with ripe blackberry fruits. Six months in wood added a toasty character enhancing the complexity and depth of the wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Monte da Ravasqueira 2016 Superior Red (Alentejano)

description: Produced by the winemaking team of Casa Santos Lima in Lisboa, this wine has rich black fruits and a soft texture. Its depth, concentration and richness are finely integrated—full and fruity with a core of firmer tannins. Drink now.
title: Quinta de Porrais 2015 Sete Vales Red (Douro)

description: A spicy, ripe wine that is part of the second line from Quinta de la Rosa. With its rich tannins, fine layers of acidity and sweet berry fruit, it is already drinkable. Give it 2–3 years and it will develop beyond its just fruity stage.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 DouRosa Red (Douro)

description: Two classic Dão grapes, Touriga Nacional and Tinta Roriz are blended in this powerful wine. It has dark tannins that still give dryness at the heart of the wine. Alongside that are the beautiful black fruits, dense structure and balanced acidity. The wine will be better from 2018 as the tannins soften further.
title: Quinta de Lemos 2010 Dona Georgina Red (Dão)

description: Old vines in a field blend give a rich structured wine that has dark tannins and powerful black fruits. It is firm, very concentrated with dense fruit as much as dense tannins. This wine could still age another few months, so drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2011 Monte Cascas Grande Reserva Red (Douro)

description: This rich wine has a firm structure as well as ripe fruit. Foot trodden in stone troughs. It has a generous Port-like texture that is balanced by the black currant acidity and delicious fruitiness. Drink from 2017.
title: Quinta da Pacheca 2013 Pacheca Superior Red (Douro)

description: This mature wine that has 50% Touriga Nacional in its blend, is firm and structured, with a smooth edge of wood aging that makes it very drinkable now. A black plum skin texture gives the wine extra concentration. Drink until 2025.
title: Seacampo 2011 Reserva Red (Dão)

description: Celebrating the Portuguese discovery of the spice route, this blend from different regions is smooth, rich and ripe. It has tannins that enhance the ripe black fruits and bring out the spicy edge to the wine. It is ready to drink.
title: Sogrape 2014 Silk & Spice Red (Portuguese Table Wine)
